required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 18, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Covid-19 Affliction on Psychological and Mental Health Among College Going Students: Cross-Sectional Survey
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Covid-19 Affliction on Psychological and Mental Health of the College Students: Cross-Sectional Survey

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to study the effects of Novel corona virus (COVID-19) on the psychological and mental health of college going students. Online version of the Event Impact Scale - Revised will be used to filled by the students who got afflicted by the novel corona virus (COVID-19).

detailed_description.textblock:
Objective : To study the impact on psychological and mental health of COVID-19 affliction among college going students
Methodology:
Study Design: Cross-sectional Mode of implementation: Online surveys Population : COVID positive College students Inclusion criteria: Students positive to corona tests Exclusion criteria: students negative to corona tests

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 1 month of the impact of COVID-19
primary_outcome.description: The IES-R is a 22-item self-report measure (for DSM-IV) that assesses subjective distress caused by traumatic events. It is a revised version of the older version, the 15-item IES (Horowitz, Wilner, & Alvarez, 1979). The IES-R contains seven additional items related to the hyperarousal symptoms of PTSD, which were not included in the original IES. Items correspond directly to 14 of the 17 DSM-IV symptoms of PTSD

arm_group.description: COLLEGE STUDENTS WITH POSITIVE COVID-19 TEST

intervention.description: THE INTERVENTION GROUP IS NOT APPLICABLE TO THE CURRENT STUDY DESIGN

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: Students positive for COVID-19 test -
Exclusion Criteria: Students negative for COVID-19 test
-

patient_data.ipd_description: The Data cannot be shared without the prior approval of the University
